title: Windows 11, and Windows 10 now support dozens of new AMD chipsets
text:
Follow us Share this article Latest news Check out the latest AMD chipsets that support Windows 11, and Windows 10. 2 min. read Published on March 14, 2024 published on 

March 14, 2024 Share this article Read the affiliate disclosure page to find out how can you help Windows Report effortlessly and without spending any money. Read more After Microsoft revealed support for multiple new Intel chipsets, but no new AMD chipsets, the tech giant, which came in second in revenues in the 2023 Q4 period after Intel, revealed that dozens of the new AMD chipsets will now be supported in Windows 11, and Windows 10. On the occasion, the tech giant also revealed a new set of Ryzen Chipset drivers (version 6.02.07.2300), which fixes bugs, and acknowledges several known issues: Below, you can see all the new AMD chipsets and processors that can support Windows 11, and Windows 10. Chipset Support Processor Support You can read the full blog post and download the latest AMD drivers here.
